title: Health of fish stocks by fish group

msy.title: Maximum Sustainable Yield
msy.content: The Maximum Sustainable Yield (MSY) is a term used in fisheries science to measure the sustainability of fish stocks. It is the point at which we can catch as much fish as possible without reducing that fish population below the most productive level. It’s where fish catch is equal to the reproduction rate.

subtitle:
Fish stocks are measured by their biomass: the number of individuals multiplied by their mass.

Here it's measured as the biomass of a fish stock divided by the biomass at its [maximum sustainable yield](#dod:msy) – the level at which we can catch the maximum amount of fish without a decline in fish populations. A value of one maximises fish catch without decreasing fish populations.
originUrl: I was trying to ask if there are only tsvs in owid-content. What makes explorers work is in owid-grapher, right?

comparisonLines.label: This line = Fish stocks are at the maximum sustainable yield
